content:
• Thursday, December 15, 2011
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM) announces plans to sell more common stock and warrants in an effort to raise...

    StemCells (STEM) announces plans to sell more common stock and warrants in an effort to raise funds for product development. The offer comes as a surprise to investors, considering the company effected a 1-for-10 reverse stock split earlier this year as part of an effort to meet Nasdaq listing rules and increase the shares' appeal to investors. Shares -10.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    Mea culpa: RIMM co-CEOs Jim Balsillie and Mike Lazaridis say they will only draw a yearly salary...

    Mea culpa: RIMM co-CEOs Jim Balsillie and Mike Lazaridis say they will only draw a yearly salary of $1, effective immediately, after issuing a dreary outlook. Investors are not mollified, as shares now -7.6% AH, and platitudes like “we will leave no stone unturned” in fixing the company sound like too little, too late.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZQK

    Quicksilver's (NYSE:ZQK) FQ4 misses EPS estimates but beats on revenues as the company swings to...

    Quicksilver's (NYSE:ZQK) FQ4 misses EPS estimates but beats on revenues as the company swings to a profit, largely due to a tax adjustment. The company reported an EPS of $0.06 per share on revenue of $545M, missing its EPS consensus by a penny, but easily beating analysts sales estimates of $527M. Shares +6.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • BB

    More on Research In Motion's (RIMM) FQ3 report: FQ4 revenue and EPS forecasts well below a...

    More on Research In Motion's (RIMM) FQ3 report: FQ4 revenue and EPS forecasts well below a consensus of $5.27B and $1.19. FQ3 BlackBerry shipments of 14.1M up 33% Q/Q thanks to product refresh, but down slightly Y/Y. Subscribers rose by 5M Q/Q and 20M Y/Y, to 75M. Only 150K PlayBook tablets shipped during quarter. RIMM -6.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 7 Comments
  • ADBE

    More on Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) FQ4 report: Deferred revenue rose 10% Q/Q to $531.7M. The company...

    More on Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) FQ4 report: Deferred revenue rose 10% Q/Q to $531.7M. The company expects FQ1 revenue of $1.025B-$1.075B and EPS of $0.54-$0.59. While the figures are in-line with a consensus of $1.05B and $0.58, they're going over well with investors rattled by recent weakness. Guidance for FY12 (ends Nov. '12) is being reaffirmed. ADBE +3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • WRK

    MeadWestvaco (MWV +3.1%) finishes higher after BMO Capital upgrades the stock to Outperform,...

    MeadWestvaco (MWV +3.1%) finishes higher after BMO Capital upgrades the stock to Outperform, citing its high dividend yield and growth from its Brazilian subsidiary Rigesa.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ELN

    Elan (ELN +3.6%) gains after Deutsche upped the shares to Buy earlier today, citing optimism...

    Elan (ELN +3.6%) gains after Deutsche upped the shares to Buy earlier today, citing optimism over the company's pending FY12 data release for its Alzheimer’s disease treatment bapineuzumab.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • CAMP

    CalAmp (CAMP +11.9%) shares rally after the company says it began shipping a new whole-home...

    CalAmp (CAMP +11.9%) shares rally after the company says it began shipping a new whole-home video and data networking product to its main North American direct broadcast satellite customer. CalAmp expects "meaningful revenue contributions" from the product beginning in the current quarter and extending into the next fiscal year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • UFS

    Canadian paper manufacturer Domtar (UFS +5.4%) trades higher after its board authorizes a $400M...

    Canadian paper manufacturer Domtar (UFS +5.4%) trades higher after its board authorizes a $400M increase to its share buyback program. The original program announced in May, 2010 now has an aggregate authorization of $1B.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • DFS

    Discover (DFS -3.2%) sells off despite beating earnings and a dividend boost. Spooking investors...

    Discover (DFS -3.2%) sells off despite beating earnings and a dividend boost. Spooking investors are worries the company has seen the best of credit improvements. Discover released just $68M in reserves into the profit column in FQ4 against $359M in FQ3. "It's going to be harder for card stocks to outperform over the next 6-12 months," says Donald Fandetti from Citigroup. DFS +24.5% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • AMPE

    Shares of Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE -23.3%) sink after an article asserts Ampio's drug Zertane...

    Shares of Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE -23.3%) sink after an article asserts Ampio's drug Zertane will not be approved by regulators. Ampio has been testing Zertane for the treatment of premature ejaculation, and the drug is currently in Phase III clinical trials. Quoting an (anonymous) biotech fund manager: "Zertane... is laughable and has zero chance of approval."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • AMCC

    AppliedMicro (AMCC +3.7%) is moving higher thanks to speculative comments from Wnderlich's Sandy...

    AppliedMicro (AMCC +3.7%) is moving higher thanks to speculative comments from Wnderlich's Sandy Harrison, who thinks the company's efforts to build server chips based on ARM's (NASDAQ:ARMH) next-gen CPU architecture opens up a major opportunity in the cloud server market, and could turn the company into an acquisition target. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • GEVO

    Bioproduct developer Gevo (GEVO +13.8%) jumps after being selected by Coca Cola (KO +1%) as one...

    Bioproduct developer Gevo (GEVO +13.8%) jumps after being selected by Coca Cola (KO +1%) as one of three companies that will try to commercialize a 100% plant-based soda bottle over the next couple years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • LBTYA

    Liberty Global (LBTYA +3.5%) spikes higher announcing a new $1B stock buyback program. Earlier...

    Liberty Global (LBTYA +3.5%) spikes higher announcing a new $1B stock buyback program. Earlier today, the company announced it had closed its purchase of KBW, Germany's third-largest cable provider.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • DMND

    The latest piece of bad news for Diamond Foods (DMND -6.3%): Heretofore bullish Jefferies throws...

    The latest piece of bad news for Diamond Foods (DMND -6.3%): Heretofore bullish Jefferies throws in the towel, downgrading shares and whacking its price target to $27 from $46. "The announced SEC investigation creates too much of an overhang with uncertain timing and increases the risk that the Pringles deal will be terminated," Jefferies says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • ALXA

    Shares of Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) fall off another 16%, and have now given...

    Shares of Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) fall off another 16%, and have now given back almost all of their gains from Tuesday's rocket ride following FDA approval for Adasuve. An influence on ALXA's share price could be a FDA panel that TheStreet.com's Adam Feurstein calls "confusing."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • ENER

    Solar product manufacturer Energy Conversion Devices (ENER -12.5%) gets slammed after saying it...

    Solar product manufacturer Energy Conversion Devices (ENER -12.5%) gets slammed after saying it will defer payment on some debt interest due today to give it more time to continue talks with creditors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • NUVA

    Goldman Sachs cuts its price target on NuVasive (NUVA -4.2%) to $14 from $17 and lowers its EPS...

    Goldman Sachs cuts its price target on NuVasive (NUVA -4.2%) to $14 from $17 and lowers its EPS outlook to reflect the $37M redemption of convertible debt the medical device company announced earlier this week as well as reduced estimates for the U.S. spine market.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • SOA

    Specialty chemical manufacturer Solutia (SOA +2.8%) gains after its board authorizes the...

    Specialty chemical manufacturer Solutia (SOA +2.8%) gains after its board authorizes the company's first dividend, affirms its guidance for the year and unveils long-term growth plans at its investor day today.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CS

    Credit Suisse (CS +3%) outpaces other bank stocks (XLF +0.5%) on announcing a sweeping...

    Credit Suisse (CS +3%) outpaces other bank stocks (XLF +0.5%) on announcing a sweeping reorganization of its foreign exchange business, including the departure of its head of forex sales. The bank's emerging markets business, which has so far encompassed both debt and currencies, will combine with its forex business in next year's Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • LB

    Victoria's Secret has given a nice lift to Limited Brands' (LTD -1.2%) bottom line, but the...

    Victoria's Secret has given a nice lift to Limited Brands' (LTD -1.2%) bottom line, but the popular brand may be weighing on shares today as a Bloomberg story describes the use of forced child labor at Burkina Faso's "fair-trade" cotton farms, where the product is used to make underwear for Victoria's Secret.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEDU

    Global Education & Technology (GEDU -3.4%) sells off after Absaroka Capital issues a report...

    Global Education & Technology (GEDU -3.4%) sells off after Absaroka Capital issues a report (.pdf) stating the SEC filed an Amended Complaint against the company yesterday. The complaint alleges GEDU's Chairman and CEO each participated in an "insider trading syndicate" ahead of Pearson's (NYSE:PSO) deal to acquire the company. Shares fell more sharply last week on a critical Absaroka report.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • RAD

    Rite-Aid (RAD +4.4%) posts a solid gain today after its Q3 results beat across the board. Losses...

    Rite-Aid (RAD +4.4%) posts a solid gain today after its Q3 results beat across the board. Losses narrowed on continued growth in same-store sales and strong pharmacy sales that benefited from higher flu-immunizations. The drug-store chain has administered over 1.4M flu shots to date, double last year's 675K count. The company also raises guidance for FY11, now expecting an EPS loss of $0.37 - $0.50 on sales of $25.86B to $26B and same-store sales growth of between 1.2% - 1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATHN

    Athena Health (ATHN -16.9%) plunges after establishing 2012 revenue guidance of $410M-$430M and...

    Athena Health (ATHN -16.9%) plunges after establishing 2012 revenue guidance of $410M-$430M and EPS guidance of $0.85-$0.97; while the former is in-line with a consensus of $423.5M, the latter is well below a consensus of $1.16. Athena is currently hosting its annual Investor Summit (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • EXC

    Exelon (EXC +0.6%) and Constellation Energy (CEG +1.7%) agree to boost investments they will...

    Exelon (EXC +0.6%) and Constellation Energy (CEG +1.7%) agree to boost investments they will make in Maryland as part of a settlement reached with the state in connection with the companies' merger. EXC and CEG say they plan to spend $1B-plus in Maryland, more than double an earlier proposal, on projects that could create more than 6,000 jobs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +6.2%) moves up on a Mizuho upgrade to Buy, saying the company is benefiting...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +6.2%) moves up on a Mizuho upgrade to Buy, saying the company is benefiting from Muve Music sales and seasonally strong trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • CCE-OLD

    Coca-Cola Enterprises (CCE-OLD +1.5%) gains after saying FY11 earnings will come in at the high...

    Coca-Cola Enterprises (CCE-OLD +1.5%) gains after saying FY11 earnings will come in at the high end of its prior forecast, and FY12 will be above expectations as well. The company expects this year's EPS to be around $2.14 - $2.18, and for FY12 it predicts EPS growth of between 10% - 12%. Analysts were looking for growth of 10% and 4% respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • KIOR

    KiOR (KIOR +10.4%) pops on a valuation upgrade to Neutral at Baird. The stock is down nearly 48%...

    KiOR (KIOR +10.4%) pops on a valuation upgrade to Neutral at Baird. The stock is down nearly 48% after hitting its peak 52-week high in late September, retracing virtually all of the gains from its run in early August and now re-testing near-term support.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • HURN

    Shares of Huron Consulting (HURN +6.3%) churn higher after the firm catches on with investors...

    Shares of Huron Consulting (HURN +6.3%) churn higher after the firm catches on with investors following yesterday's upgrade from SunTrust to Buy from Neutral. The company announced plans to expand its healthcare business with the hiring of a key exec to help it drive into the niche market of helping hospitals with expense and supply chain management.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • T

    DirecTV (DTV -3%) dips after Nomura cuts its rating on the stock to Reduce, saying the shares...

    DirecTV (DTV -3%) dips after Nomura cuts its rating on the stock to Reduce, saying the shares don't deserve the hefty premium they command now. Latin American growth and buyback efforts have distracted investors from the more pressing matter of deteriorating domestic fundamentals and the high cost the company is paying to gain and retain subscriptions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • WWAY

    Shares in Westway (NASDAQ:WWAY), which provides storage services for bulk liquid products, are...

    Shares in Westway (NASDAQ:WWAY), which provides storage services for bulk liquid products, are +10% after it says it will review its strategic alternatives following an unsolicited offer for some of its ops from its largest shareholder, ED&F Man. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +1.4%) says the FDA has accepted a New Drug Application for its...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +1.4%) says the FDA has accepted a New Drug Application for its cystic-fibrosis drug Kalydecotm, and granted the company's request for six-month priority review. The drug targets the defective protein that causes cystic fibrosis, and, if approved, would be the first treatment to specifically target the underlying cause of of the disease. Separately, the company also names a new CEO to succeed Matthew Emmens, who will retire early next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • WDR

    Financial planner Waddell & Reed (WDR +3.1%) hikes its dividend a surprising 25% to...

    Financial planner Waddell & Reed (WDR +3.1%) hikes its dividend a surprising 25% to $0.25/share, a meaningful margin over the average 3.3% from its peers, Citi analyst William Katz says. Still, Katz prefers Invesco (NYSE:IVZ), where he sees stronger growth vs. WDR, and BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) for its "improving consistency in organic growth."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +1.9%) gains after being initiated with a Buy at Maxim, noting its margins are...

    Cree (CREE +1.9%) gains after being initiated with a Buy at Maxim, noting its margins are reaching a bottom, and it expects the LED lighting company to benefit from growth in the non-residential outdoor lighting market.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • SCHL

    Scholastic (SCHL +4.2%) execs give a peek under the hood in an earnings CC discussing FQ2...

    Scholastic (SCHL +4.2%) execs give a peek under the hood in an earnings CC discussing FQ2 results. The most interesting tidbit is the firm's sweeping commitment to take its business to an online model including cutting costs and reducing a voluntary retirement program to find the money for technology spending. Scholastic hopes to realize gains from its investment when it launches ereading apps in ebookstores this spring and a broad ebook launch to teachers and parent customers for back-to-school 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • LRCX

    Lam Research's (LRCX -3.7%) proposed acquisition (I, II) of Novellus (NVLS-OLD +21.1%) is giving...

    Lam Research's (LRCX -3.7%) proposed acquisition (I, II) of Novellus (NVLS-OLD +21.1%) is giving a lift to several of the companies' peers, as investors hope the merger of the third and fourth largest U.S. chip equipment makers will spur further consolidation in the downtrodden industry. UTEK +5.8%. CYMI +4.1%. NANO +3.7%. KLIC +4.6%. ASMI +3.3%. AIXG +3.5%. MKSI +3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • BWA

    Shares of BorgWarner (BWA +2%) reverse course following a brief dip at the open after UBS...

    Shares of BorgWarner (BWA +2%) reverse course following a brief dip at the open after UBS downgrades the shares to Neutral, citing its relative valuation. Separately, the stock is due to be added to the S&P 500 at the close of trading tomorrow, and the stock's weakness over the past few days may have afforded index investors the opportunity to do a little bottom-fishing.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (VECO +2.3%) trades higher after bouncing off a 52-week low, despite being...

    Veeco Instruments (VECO +2.3%) trades higher after bouncing off a 52-week low, despite being initiated with a Sell at Maxim earlier today. Maxim says it expects the LED equipment manufacturer's earnings to remain subdued into the first half of 2013 due to weak capex spending.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • ITMN

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN -24.1%) crater on word that a German science board tied to the...

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN -24.1%) crater on word that a German science board tied to the government is starting to raise doubts about the benefit of the firm's pirfenidone treatment. (report in German).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +1.6%) receives a notice of allowance from the U.S. Patent Office for...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +1.6%) receives a notice of allowance from the U.S. Patent Office for its Northera Controlled Release Formulation patent application. The patent will establish protection for the drug's once-a-day treatment beyond the seven-year marketing exclusivity afforded by its orphan designation in the U.S..

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • FSLR

    Baird piles-on to the beating in First Solar (FSLR -5.4%), cutting the shares to Neutral and...

    Baird piles-on to the beating in First Solar (FSLR -5.4%), cutting the shares to Neutral and slashing its price target to $35 from $80 following the company's reduced 2011 guidance and 2012 outlook yesterday. In what amounts to a big, fat mea culpa, the firm says: "We've been wrong on our recommendation and misjudged the negative impact its attempt to reinvent itself from a technology to an energy company would have."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -2.8%) picked the wrong smartphone and the wrong carrier for its return to the U.S....

    Nokia (NOK -2.8%) picked the wrong smartphone and the wrong carrier for its return to the U.S. market, Doug McIntyre argues. While its flagship Lumia 800 will not be released for several weeks, the low-end Lumia 710 isn't likely to create a positive first impression, and T-Mobile is the weakest of the large U.S. carriers and in the difficult position of an aborted AT&T buyout.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 3 Comments
  • CPRI

    Luxury-apparel designer Michael Kors (KORS) jumps 24.2% on its trading debut on the NYSE after...

    Luxury-apparel designer Michael Kors (KORS) jumps 24.2% on its trading debut on the NYSE after it sells 47.2M shares at $20 each. However, with all the stock that was sold coming from insiders, the company won't benefit from any of the proceeds.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +5.4%) gains after announcing pricing on its common stock offering....

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +5.4%) gains after announcing pricing on its common stock offering. A total of 21.5M shares will be priced to the public at $10.42/share in a deal expected to close on or about Dec. 20.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • LRCX

    Lam Research (LRCX -3.2%) shares slide after yesterday's announcement of its Novellus (NVLS-OLD...

    Lam Research (LRCX -3.2%) shares slide after yesterday's announcement of its Novellus (NVLS-OLD +21.7%) acquisition, but Needham's Ed Mok is a fan of the deal, upgrading LRCX to a Buy rating with a $46 target. He believes the combined company “will be substantially stronger" than the current Lam Research, in part by adding Intel as one of its customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • FDX

    Resist the urge to extrapolate FedEx's (FDX +4.8%) solid results and outlook to the broader U.S....

    Resist the urge to extrapolate FedEx's (FDX +4.8%) solid results and outlook to the broader U.S. economy, writes Mark Gongloff. The company's radar has been off this year, optimistic in March just before the economy rolled over and pessimistic in September, just ahead of a run of better economic data.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks (AMCX +3.1%) trades higher after JPMorgan starts coverage with an Overweight and...

    AMC Networks (AMCX +3.1%) trades higher after JPMorgan starts coverage with an Overweight and $43 PT, citing a healthy outlook for TV advertising. In what could also be seen as a positive for names such as SNI and DISCA, JPMorgan expects U.S. TV ad spending to grow at a mid-single-digit clip next year, outpacing the 3.5% growth it sees for ad spending in general.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • ZOLL

    Zoll Medical (ZOLL +11.7%) announces that CMS coverage for its LifeVest Wearable Defribrillator...

    Zoll Medical (ZOLL +11.7%) announces that CMS coverage for its LifeVest Wearable Defribrillator was reaffirmed after it received positive support across the cardiology-focused community. Shares will actively trade again at 11:00 AM EST after being halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • WGO

    Winnebago (WGO -3.8%) misses FQ1 estimates across the board as profits take a dual-pronged hit...

    Winnebago (WGO -3.8%) misses FQ1 estimates across the board as profits take a dual-pronged hit from a jump in material costs and reduced demand. Earnings slid 73% Y/Y as inventory expenses rose and margins weakened, while high fuel prices and persistent concerns over the health of the U.S. economy kept buyers at bay, translating into a 6.3% Y/Y decline in motor home deliveries.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • FSLR

    Speculation that First Solar's (FSLR -9.8%) reduced share price - cut by two-thirds in three...

    Speculation that First Solar's (FSLR -9.8%) reduced share price - cut by two-thirds in three months - makes it takeover bait hasn't stopped the bleeding caused by yesterday's downward guidance. Citigroup's Timothy Arcuri says going private may be the more likely scenario, given the “massive lumpiness" of results due to its large-scale projects and related up-front capital requirements.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • APOG

    Commercial glassmaker Apogee Enterprises (APOG +10.4%) is up sharply after reporting FQ3 revenue...

    Commercial glassmaker Apogee Enterprises (APOG +10.4%) is up sharply after reporting FQ3 revenue of $174.9M (+19% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.20, beating consensus by $4.1M and $0.08. The company's gross margin rose 420 bps Y/Y, to 19.9%. Apogee now expects 14% revenue growth in FY12 (ends in February), above prior guidance for 10% growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • RTK

    Shares of Rentech (RTK -3.7%) tail off after the firm showed a wider-than-expected loss for FQ4,...

    Shares of Rentech (RTK -3.7%) tail off after the firm showed a wider-than-expected loss for FQ4, reporting -$0.04 vs. -$0.02 consensus. The energy concern reiterates its forecast for cash distributions in FY12 at $2.34/unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT -1.9%) dips on a lukewarm Neutral initiation by JP Morgan, saying European...

    Acme Packet (APKT -1.9%) dips on a lukewarm Neutral initiation by JP Morgan, saying European revenue exposure is too high, and its EPS estimates are 6.3% and 13.5% below consensus for 2012 and 2013 respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • TMUS

    Shares of MetroPCS (PCS +4.7%) jump following an upgrade to Buy and a raised target price to...

    Shares of MetroPCS (PCS +4.7%) jump following an upgrade to Buy and a raised target price to $10.50 from $8.50 at Mizuho Securities. Q4 subscriber growth is "tracking ahead of expectations," Mizuho says, viewing PCS as "an attractive near-term trading opportunity with the potential to benefit from seasonally strong trends and a discount valuation."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • WBMD

    There's nothing like a bidding war to get shares moving in the right direction, as witnessed by...

    There's nothing like a bidding war to get shares moving in the right direction, as witnessed by the rally in WebMD (WBMD +9.9%) following news that P-E firms are kicking the tires. A tad late on the scene, Goldman Sachs fires up coverage at Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • JBLU

    JetBlue (JBLU +2.1%) picks Pratt & Whitney (UTX +0.4%) in a ~$1B order for 86 engines...

    JetBlue (JBLU +2.1%) picks Pratt & Whitney (UTX +0.4%) in a ~$1B order for 86 engines to equip 40 Airbus SAS A320neo jets the carrier ordered earlier this year, beating out GE and Safran (OTCPK:SAFRY) joint venture CFM International. It's the first U.S. airline customer for the PurePower geared turbofan engine on the A320neo.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • ZOLL

    Trading on Zoll Medical (NASDAQ:ZOLL) is halted pending a news announcement. Shares were up 11%...

    Trading on Zoll Medical (NASDAQ:ZOLL) is halted pending a news announcement. Shares were up 11% before the stop in action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • DYN

    Dynegy Holdings, a unit of energy producer Dynegy (DYN +4%), settles its dispute with Public...

    Dynegy Holdings, a unit of energy producer Dynegy (DYN +4%), settles its dispute with Public Service Enterprise Group, which had filed for dismissal of the company's bankruptcy motion. PSEG's rights and claims were settled in return for allowing its affiliate an unsecured claim of $110M against Dynegy Holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • SNI

    Shares of Schiff Nutrition (SNI -3.1%) fall off the firm reports FQ2 earnings. The maker of...

    Shares of Schiff Nutrition (SNI -3.1%) fall off the firm reports FQ2 earnings. The maker of vitamins and nutritional supplements expects very high single-digit operating margin for FY12, with higher operating expenses than previously forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (SWKS +4.6%) trades higher after Deutsche's Jonathan Goldberg, who had downgraded...

    Skyworks (SWKS +4.6%) trades higher after Deutsche's Jonathan Goldberg, who had downgraded shares in June, upgrades them to Buy. Goldberg thinks the 37% decline seen by mobile power amplifier vendor over the last 2 months is excessive, and expects the ongoing adoption of 3G and 4G networks to drive long-term growth. However, he thinks calendar Q4 results will be merely in-line with guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • ATRS

    Shares of Antares Pharma (AIS -22%) sink after studies on BioSante Pharmaceuticals' (BPAX)...

    Shares of Antares Pharma (AIS -22%) sink after studies on BioSante Pharmaceuticals' (BPAX) hormone-replacement LibiGel crash and burn. Anates had big plans to develop the delivery system for the drug. BPAX is off 77% premarket.
